alert.note: Alert for Central Plaquemines; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 6:40AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern St. Bernard, south central Orleans, east central Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 730 AM CDT... At 638 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing brief, weak waterspouts and wind gusts 30 to 40mph along a line extending from near Belle Chasse to 7 miles northeast of Myrtle Grove. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Belle Chasse, Timberlane, Jean Lafitte, Myrtle Grove, Violet, Meraux, Shell Beach, Poydras, Arabi and Terrytown. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If you see a waterspout, take shelter indoors and wait for the storm to pass. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Plaquemines; Lower Jefferson; Lower Plaquemines; Lower St. Bernard; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
